alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Chattooga; Cherokee; Floyd; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 5:14PM EDT until June 25 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cherokee County in north central Georgia... Floyd County in northwestern Georgia... Northeastern Fulton County in north central Georgia... Chattooga County in northwestern Georgia... Bartow County in northwestern Georgia... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 514 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lyerly to Reavis Mountain, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Rome, Canton, Cartersville, Summerville, Mountain Park, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Milton, Woodstock, Acworth, Holly Springs, Adairsville, Euharlee, Emerson, Ball Ground, Cave Spring, White, Waleska and Kingston. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If you see wind damage...hail or flooding...wait until the storm has passed...and then call the National Weather Service toll free at 1 8 6 6 7 6 3 4 4 6 6 or tweet us your report at NWSATLANTA.
